Hey, I'm Danny Trejo, a legend in the world of cinema. Born on May 20, 1944, in Eagle Rock, Los Angeles, California, to Mexican parents, my life has been anything but ordinary. I've seen the brightest sides of life, as well as the darkest.

As a young child, I found solace in the church, singing and playing the organ. However, I also started getting into trouble, and my life took a turn when I joined a gang at the age of 16. This led to a 20-year prison sentence, where I found a passion for acting, taking part in prison plays and performances.

After serving my time, I was released and moved to Mexico for a short while. However, I couldn't stay away from Los Angeles, and in 1974, I returned to the city, working various odd jobs and doing some minor acting gigs.

My big break came in 1985, when I landed the role of 'Miguel', the gruff bouncer in the iconic movie 'Breaking Bad'. This role catapulted me into stardom, and I soon became a go-to character actor, often playing tough, gritty roles. Some of my most memorable roles include 'Las Chulas' in 'Desperado', 'Ray Merrimen' in 'Men in Black II', and 'Miguel Galindo' in 'Grindhouse'.

I've worked with some of the biggest names in the film industry, such as Quentin Tarantino, Steven Spielberg, and George Lucas. My career has spanned over four decades, and I continue to be an inspiration to many aspiring actors.

Despite my tough exterior, I've always been passionate about supporting and uplifting others. I am actively involved in various charitable organizations and motivational speaking. In my personal life, I'm a loving husband to my wife, Gloria, and father to my two sons, Anthony and Danny.

In summary, my journey has been a rollercoaster ride, with its highs and lows, but I'm grateful for every experience that has shaped me into the actor and person I am today. I believe life is a movie, and I continue to live mine,
